summary.long: Numbers is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tent of meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the sons of Israel, by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, every male, head by head
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from twenty years old and upward, whoever is able to go to war in Israel. You and Aaron shall count them by their armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With you, moreover, there shall be a man of each tribe, each one head of his father’s household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These then are the names of the men who shall stand with you: of the tribe of Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the sons of Joseph: of Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud; of Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Asher, Pagiel the son of Ochran;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men who were called from the congregation, the leaders of their fathers’ tribes; they were the heads of divisions of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron took these men who had been designated by name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they assembled all the congregation on the first day of the second month. Then they registered by ancestry in their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, head by head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Lord had commanded Moses. So he counted them in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sons of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Reuben were 46,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Simeon, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, their numbered men, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Simeon were 59,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Gad, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Gad were 45,650.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Judah, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Judah were 74,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Issachar, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Issachar were 54,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Zebulun, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Zebulun were 57,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Joseph, namely, of the sons of Ephraim, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Ephraim were 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Manasseh, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Manasseh were 32,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Benjamin, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Benjamin were 35,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Dan, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Dan were 62,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Asher, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Asher were 41,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Naphtali, their descendants by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men of the tribe of Naphtali were 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones who were numbered, whom Moses and Aaron counted, with the leaders of Israel, twelve men, each of whom was of his father’s household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the numbered men of the sons of Israel by their fathers’ households, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go to war in Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the numbered men were 603,550.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites, however, were not counted among them by their fathers’ tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had spoken to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Only the tribe of Levi you shall not count, nor shall you take their census among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the testimony, and over all its furnishings and over everything that belongs to it. They shall carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings, and they shall take care of it; they shall also camp around the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the tabernacle is to move on, the Levites shall take it down; and when the tabernacle encamps, the Levites shall set it up. But the layman who comes near it shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sons of Israel shall camp, each man by his own camp, and each man by his own flag, according to their armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites shall camp around the tabernacle of the testimony, so that there will be no divine wrath against the congregation of the sons of Israel. So the Levites shall be responsible for service to the tabernacle of the testimony.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel did so; in accordance with all that the Lord had commanded Moses, so they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The sons of Israel shall camp, each by his own flag, with the banners of their fathers’ households; they shall camp around the tent of meeting at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who camp on the east side toward the sunrise shall be of the flag of the camp of Judah, by their armies; and the leader of the sons of Judah: Nahshon the son of Amminadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 74,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar; and the leader of the sons of Issachar: Nethanel the son of Zuar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 54,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then follows the tribe of Zebulun; and the leader of the sons of Zebulun: Eliab the son of Helon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, his numbered men: 57,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Judah: 186,400, by their armies. They shall set out first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the south side shall be the flag of the camp of Reuben by their armies; and the leader of the sons of Reuben: Elizur the son of Shedeur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 46,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon; and the leader of the sons of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 59,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then follows the tribe of Gad; and the leader of the sons of Gad: Eliasaph the son of Deuel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 45,650.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Reuben: 151,450 by their armies. And they shall set out second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the tent of meeting shall set out with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camps; just as they camp, so they shall set out, every man in his place by their flags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the west side shall be the flag of the camp of Ephraim by their armies; and the leader of the sons of Ephraim: Elishama the son of Ammihud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next to him shall be the tribe of Manasseh; and the leader of the sons of Manasseh: Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men, 32,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then follows the tribe of Benjamin; and the leader of the sons of Benjamin: Abidan the son of Gideoni,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men, 35,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Ephraim: 108,100, by their armies. And they shall set out third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the north side shall be the flag of the camp of Dan by their armies; and the leader of the sons of Dan: Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 62,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Asher; and the leader of the sons of Asher: Pagiel the son of Ochran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 41,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then follows the tribe of Naphtali; and the leader of the sons of Naphtali: Ahira the son of Enan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his army, their numbered men: 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Dan was 157,600. They shall set out last by their flags.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbered men of the sons of Israel by their fathers’ households; the total of the numbered men of the camps by their armies, 603,550.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites, however, were not counted among the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sons of Israel did all this; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so they camped by their flags, and so they set out, everyone by his family according to his father’s household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the records of the generations of Aaron and Moses at the time when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These then are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, whom he ordained to serve as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died in the presence of the Lord when they offered strange fire before the Lord in the wilderness of Sinai; and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the lifetime of their father Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring the tribe of Levi forward and present them before Aaron the priest, that they may serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall perform the duties for him and for the whole congregation in front of the tent of meeting, to do the service of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall also take care of all the furnishings of the tent of meeting, along with the duties of the sons of Israel, to do the service of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall assign the Levites to Aaron and to his sons; they are exclusively assigned to him from the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall appoint Aaron and his sons that they may keep their priesthood, but the layman who comes near shall be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, behold, I have taken the Levites from among the sons of Israel instead of every firstborn, the firstborn of the womb among the sons of Israel. So the Levites shall be Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the firstborn are Mine; on the day that I fatally struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified to Myself all the firstborn in Israel, from the human firstborn to animals. They shall be Mine; I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Count the sons of Levi by their fathers’ households, by their families; every male from a month old and upward you shall count.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses counted them according to the word of the Lord, just as he had been commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These, then, are the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Kohath by their families: Amram and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ households.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Gershon was the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimeites; these were the families of the Gershonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their numbered men, in the counting of every male from a month old and upward, their numbered men were 7,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the Gershonites were to camp behind the tabernacle westward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the leader of the fathers’ households of the Gershonites: Eliasaph the son of Lael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the duties of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting included the tabernacle and the tent, its covering, and the curtain for the entrance of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the curtains of the courtyard, the curtain for the entrance of the courtyard which is around the tabernacle and the altar, and its ropes, according to all the service concerning them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Kohath was the family of the Amramites, the family of the Izharites, the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites; these were the families of the Kohathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the counting of every male from a month old and upward, there were 8,600, performing the duties of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the sons of Kohath were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the leader of the fathers’ households of the Kohathite families: Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now their duties included the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the utensils of the sanctuary with which they minister, the curtain, and all the service concerning them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest was the head of the leaders of Levi, and he had the supervision of those who performed the duties of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Merari was the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites; these were the families of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their numbered men in the counting of every male from a month old and upward: 6,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the leader of the fathers’ households of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. They were to camp on the northward side of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the appointment of duties of the sons of Merari included the framework of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, its bases, all its equipment, and all the service concerning them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pillars around the courtyard with their bases, their pegs, and their ropes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who were to camp in front of the tabernacle eastward, in front of the tent of meeting toward the sunrise, were Moses and Aaron and his sons, performing the duties of the sanctuary for the obligation of the sons of Israel; but the layman coming near was to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the numbered men of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron counted at the command of the Lord by their families, every male from a month old and upward, were twenty-two thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Count every firstborn male of the sons of Israel from a month old and upward, and make a list of their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take the Levites for Me—I am the Lord—instead of all the firstborn among the sons of Israel; and the cattle of the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the cattle of the sons of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses counted all the firstborn among the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the firstborn males, by the number of names from a month old and upward for their numbered men, were 22,273.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the sons of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites in place of their cattle. And the Levites shall be Mine; I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as a redemption price for the 273 of the firstborn of the sons of Israel who are in excess of the number of the Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall take five shekels apiece, per head; you shall take them in terms of the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall give the money, the redemption price of those who are in excess among them, to Aaron and to his sons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the redemption money from those who were in excess of the number of those redeemed by the Levites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the firstborn of the sons of Israel he took the money in terms of the shekel of the sanctuary, 1,365.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and to his sons, at the command of the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the descendants of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their families, by their fathers’ households,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward, even to fifty years old, everyone who can enter the service of ministry to do work in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the work of the descendants of Kohath in the tent of meeting, concerning the most holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the camp sets out, Aaron and his sons shall go in and take down the veil of the curtain, and cover the ark of the testimony with it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall place a covering of fine leather on it, and spread over it a cloth of pure violet, and insert its carrying poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the table of the bread of the Presence they shall also spread a cloth of violet and put on it the dishes, the pans, the sacrificial bowls, and the jugs for the drink offering; and the continual bread shall be on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall spread over them a cloth of scarlet material, and cover the same with a covering of fine leather, and they shall insert its carrying poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall take a violet cloth and cover the lampstand for the light, along with its lamps, its tongs, its trays, and all its oil containers, by which they attend to it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall put it and all its utensils in a covering of fine leather, and put it on the carrying bars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the golden altar they shall spread a violet cloth, and cover it with a covering of fine leather, and they shall insert its carrying poles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall take all the utensils of service, with which they serve in the sanctuary, and put them in a violet cloth and cover them with a covering of fine leather, and put them on the carrying bars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall clean away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall also put on it all its utensils by which they serve in connection with it: the firepans, the forks, shovels, and the basins, all the utensils of the altar; and they shall spread a cover of fine leather over it and insert its carrying poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the holy objects and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, when the camp is to set out, after that the sons of Kohath shall come to carry them by the poles, so that they will not touch the holy objects and die. These are the things in the tent of meeting that the sons of Kohath are to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the responsibility of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest is the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the continual grain offering, and the anointing oil—the responsibility of all the tabernacle and everything that is in it, with the sanctuary and its furnishings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not let the tribe of the families of the Kohathites be eliminated from among the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, do this for them so that they will live and not die when they approach the most holy objects: Aaron and his sons shall go in and assign each of them to his work and to his load;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they shall not come in to see the holy objects even for a moment, or they will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers’ households, by their families;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old you shall count them: all who can enter to perform service, to do the work in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in carrying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the tent of meeting with its covering and the covering of fine leather that is on top of it, and the curtain for the entrance of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the curtains of the courtyard, the curtain for the entrance of the gate of the courtyard that is around the tabernacle and the altar, and their ropes and all the equipment for their service; and everything that is to be done by them, they shall perform.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the service of the sons of the Gershonites, that is, all their loads and all their work, shall be performed at the command of Aaron and his sons; and you shall assign to them as a duty all their loads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the tent of meeting; and their duties shall be under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for the sons of Merari, you shall count them by their families, by their fathers’ households;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward, even to fifty years old, you shall count them, everyone who can enter the service to do the work of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the duty of their loads, for all their service in the tent of meeting: the boards of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, and its bases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pillars around the courtyard and their bases, their pegs, and their ropes, with all their equipment and with all their service; and you shall assign by names of the men the items that each is to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service in the tent of meeting, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of the congregation counted the sons of the Kohathites by their families and by their fathers’ households,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who could enter the service for work in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their numbered men by their families were 2,750.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the numbered men of the Kohathite families, everyone who was serving in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of the Lord through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the numbered men of the sons of Gershon by their families and by their fathers’ households,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who could enter the service for work in the tent of meeting—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men by their families, by their fathers’ households, were 2,630.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the numbered men of the families of the sons of Gershon, everyone who was serving in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the numbered men of the families of the sons of Merari by their families, by their fathers’ households,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who could enter the service for work in the tent of meeting—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men by their families were 3,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the numbered men of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of the Lord through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the numbered men of the Levites, whom Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel counted, by their families and by their fathers’ households,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who could enter to do the work of service and the work of carrying in the tent of meeting—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their numbered men were 8,580.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the commandment of the Lord through Moses, they were counted, everyone by his serving or carrying; so these were his numbered men, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the sons of Israel that they send away from the camp everyone with leprosy, everyone having a discharge, and everyone who is unclean because of contact with a dead person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall send away both male and female; you shall send them outside the camp so that they do not defile their camp where I dwell in their midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel did so and sent them outside the camp; just as the Lord had spoken to Moses, that is what the sons of Israel did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel: ‘When a man or woman commits any of the sins of mankind, acting unfaithfully against the Lord, and that person is guilty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he shall confess his sin which he has committed, and he shall make restitution in full for his wrong and add to it a fifth of it, and give it to him whom he has wronged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the person has no redeemer to whom restitution may be made for the wrong, the restitution which is made for the wrong must go to the Lord for the priest, besides the ram of atonement, by which atonement is made for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also every contribution pertaining to all the holy gifts of the sons of Israel, which they offer to the priest, shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So every person’s holy gifts shall be his; whatever anyone gives to the priest, it becomes his.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘If any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a man has sexual relations with her and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband and she remains undiscovered, although she has defiled herself, and there is no witness against her and she has not been caught in the act,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if an attitude of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife when she has defiled herself, or if an attitude of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife when she has not defiled herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the man shall then bring his wife to the priest, and shall bring as an offering for her a tenth of an ephah of barley meal; he shall not pour oil on it nor put frankincense on it, because it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of reminder, a reminder of wrongdoing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then the priest shall bring her forward and have her stand before the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest shall take holy water in an earthenware container; and he shall take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall then have the woman stand before the Lord and let down the hair of the woman’s head, and place the grain offering of reminder in her hands, that is, the grain offering of jealousy; and in the hand of the priest is to be the water of bitterness that brings a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall have her take an oath and shall say to the woman, “If no man has had sexual relations with you and if you have not gone astray into uncleanness, as you are under the authority of your husband, be immune to this water of bitterness that brings a curse;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if, however, you have gone astray, though under the authority of your husband, and if you have defiled yourself and a man other than your husband has had sexual intercourse with you”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (then the priest shall have the woman swear with the oath of the curse, and the priest shall say to the woman), “may the Lord make you a curse and an oath among your people by the Lord’s making your thigh shriveled and your belly swollen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this water that brings a curse shall go into your stomach, to make your belly swell up and your thigh shrivel.” And the woman shall say, “Amen, Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The priest shall then write these curses on a scroll, and he shall wash them off into the water of bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he shall make the woman drink the water of bitterness that brings a curse, so that the water which brings a curse will go into her and cause bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy from the woman’s hand, and he shall wave the grain offering before the Lord and bring it to the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest shall take a handful of the grain offering as its reminder offering and offer it up in smoke on the altar, and afterward he shall make the woman drink the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has made her drink the water, then it will come about, if she has defiled herself and has been unfaithful to her husband, that the water which brings a curse will go into her and cause bitterness, and her belly will swell up and her thigh will shrivel, and the woman will become a curse among her people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, she will be immune and conceive children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is the law of jealousy: when a wife, who is under the authority of her husband, goes astray and defiles herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or when an attitude of jealousy comes over a man and he is jealous of his wife, he shall then have the woman stand before the Lord, and the priest shall apply all of this law to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man, moreover, will be free of guilt, but that woman shall bear the consequences of her guilt.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When a man or woman makes a special vow, namely, the vow of a Nazirite, to live as a Nazirite for the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall abstain from wine and strong drink; he shall consume no vinegar, whether made from wine or strong drink, nor shall he drink any grape juice nor eat fresh or dried grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of his consecration he shall not eat anything that is produced from the grape vine, from the seeds even to the skin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘All the days of his vow of consecration no razor shall pass over his head. He shall be holy until the days are fulfilled which he lives as a Nazirite for the Lord; he shall let the locks of hair on his head grow long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘All the days of his life as a Nazirite for the Lord he shall not come up to a dead person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not make himself unclean for his father or for his mother, for his brother or for his sister, when they die, because his consecration to God is on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of his consecration he is holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But if someone dies very suddenly beside him and he defiles his consecrated head of hair, then he shall shave his head on the day when he becomes clean; he shall shave it on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young doves to the priest, to the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make atonement for him regarding his sin because of the dead person. And on that same day he shall consecrate his head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall live his days of consecration as a Nazirite for the Lord, and shall bring a male lamb a year old as a guilt offering; but the preceding days will not count, because his consecration was defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Now this is the law of the Nazirite when the days of his consecration are fulfilled: he shall bring his offering to the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall present his offering to the Lord: one male lamb a year old without defect as a burnt offering, one ewe lamb a year old without defect as a sin offering, one ram without defect as a peace offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a basket of unleavened loaves of fine flour mixed with oil and unleavened wafers spread with oil, along with their grain offering and their drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall present them before the Lord and offer his sin offering and his burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall also offer the ram as a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord, together with the basket of unleavened bread; the priest shall also offer its grain offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Nazirite shall then shave his consecrated head of hair at the entrance of the tent of meeting, and take the consecrated hair of his head and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take the ram’s shoulder when it has been boiled, and one unleavened loaf from the basket and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them on the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved his consecrated hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall wave them as a wave offering before the Lord. It is holy for the priest, together with the breast offered as a wave offering, and the thigh offered as a contribution; and afterward the Nazirite may drink wine.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the law of the Nazirite who vows his offering to the Lord according to his consecration, in addition to what else he can afford; corresponding to his vow which he makes, so he shall do according to the law of his consecration.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, ‘In this way you shall bless the sons of Israel. You are to say to them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord bless you, and keep you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord cause His face to shine on you,
And be gracious to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord lift up His face to you,
And give you peace.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall invoke My name on the sons of Israel, and then I will bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the day that Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed it and consecrated it with all its furnishings, and the altar and all its utensils; he anointed them and consecrated them also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of their fathers’ households, made an offering (they were the leaders of the tribes; they were the supervisors over the numbered men).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they brought their offering before the Lord, six covered carts and twelve oxen, a cart for every two of the leaders and an ox for each one, then they presented them in front of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Accept these things from them, that they may be used in the service of the tent of meeting, and you shall give them to the Levites, to each man according to his service.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two carts and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and four carts and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did not give any to the sons of Kohath, because theirs was the service of the holy objects, which they carried on the shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the leaders offered the dedication offering for the altar when it was anointed, so the leaders offered their offering before the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “They shall present their offering, one leader each day, for the dedication of the altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the one who presented his offering on the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his offering was one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented an offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he presented as his offering one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day it was Eliab the son of Helon, leader of the sons of Zebulun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourth day it was Elizur the son of Shedeur, leader of the sons of Reuben;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifth day it was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, leader of the sons of Simeon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the sixth day it was Eliasaph the son of Deuel, leader of the sons of Gad;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day it was Elishama the son of Ammihud, leader of the sons of Ephraim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day it was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, leader of the sons of Manasseh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the ninth day it was Abidan the son of Gideoni, leader of the sons of Benjamin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the tenth day it was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, leader of the sons of Dan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eleventh day it was Pagiel the son of Ochran, leader of the sons of Asher;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Pagiel the son of Ochran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twelfth day it was Ahira the son of Enan, leader of the sons of Naphtali;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was also one silver dish whose weight was 130 shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull, one ram, and one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the dedication offering for the altar from the leaders of Israel when it was anointed: twelve silver dishes, twelve silver bowls, and twelve gold pans,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: each silver dish weighing 130 shekels and each bowl seventy; all the silver of the utensils totaled 2,400 in sanctuary shekels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelve gold pans full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece in sanctuary shekels, all the gold of the pans totaled 120 shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the oxen for the burnt offering totaled twelve bulls, all the rams, twelve, the male lambs one year old with their grain offering, twelve, and the male goats as a sin offering, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the oxen for the sacrifice of peace offerings totaled twenty-four bulls, all the rams, sixty, the male goats, sixty, and the male lambs one year old, sixty. This was the dedication offering for the altar after it was anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Moses entered the tent of meeting to speak with Him, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the atoning cover that was on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim; so He spoke to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and say to him, ‘When you mount the lamps, the seven lamps will provide light in the front of the lampstand.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Aaron did so; he mounted its lamps at the front of the lampstand, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this was the workmanship of the lampstand, hammered work of gold; from its base to its flower ornamentation it was hammered work; according to the pattern which the Lord had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the Levites from among the sons of Israel and cleanse them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you shall do to them, for their cleansing: sprinkle purifying water on them, and have them use a razor over their whole body, and they shall wash their clothes and cleanse themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then have them take a bull with its grain offering, fine flour mixed with oil; and you shall take a second bull as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall present the Levites in front of the tent of meeting. You shall also assemble the whole congregation of the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and present the Levites before the Lord; and the sons of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron then shall present the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering from the sons of Israel, so that they may qualify to perform the service of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls; then you are to offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to the Lord, to make atonement for the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall have the Levites stand before Aaron and his sons so as to present them as a wave offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you shall single out the Levites from among the sons of Israel, and the Levites shall be Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after that the Levites may go in to serve the tent of meeting. But you shall cleanse them and present them as a wave offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they are exclusively given to Me from among the sons of Israel. I have taken them for Myself instead of the firstborn of every womb, the firstborn of all the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every firstborn among the sons of Israel is Mine, among the people and among the animals; on the day that I fatally struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified them for Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have taken the Levites instead of every firstborn among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the sons of Israel, to perform the service of the sons of Israel at the tent of meeting and to make atonement on behalf of the sons of Israel, so that there will be no affliction among the sons of Israel due to their approaching the sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this is what Moses, Aaron, and all the congregation of the sons of Israel did to the Levites; according to everything that the Lord had commanded Moses regarding the Levites, so the sons of Israel did to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites, too, purified themselves from sin and washed their clothes; and Aaron presented them as a wave offering before the Lord. Aaron also made atonement for them to cleanse them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after that the Levites went in to perform their service in the tent of meeting before Aaron and his sons; just as the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what applies to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upward they shall enter to perform service in the work of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at the age of fifty years they shall retire from service in the work and not work anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They may, however, assist their brothers in the tent of meeting, to fulfill an obligation, but they themselves shall do no work. In this way you shall deal with the Levites in their obligations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the sons of Israel are to celebrate the Passover at its appointed time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, you shall celebrate it at its appointed time; you shall celebrate it in accordance with all its statutes and all its ordinances.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses told the sons of Israel to celebrate the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they celebrated the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai; in accordance with everything that the Lord had commanded Moses, so the sons of Israel did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there were some men who were unclean because of contact with a dead person, so that they could not celebrate Passover on that day; and they came before Moses and Aaron on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those men said to him, “Though we are unclean because of a dead person, why are we kept from presenting the offering of the Lord at its appointed time among the sons of Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses then said to them, “Wait, and I will listen to what the Lord will command concerning you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘If any one of you or of your generations becomes unclean because of a dead person, or is on a distant journey, he may, however, celebrate the Passover to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the second month on the fourteenth day at twilight, they shall celebrate it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not leave any of it until morning, nor break a bone of it; they shall celebrate it in accordance with the whole statute of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who is clean and is not on a journey, yet refrains from celebrating the Passover, that person shall then be cut off from his people, because he did not present the offering of the Lord at its appointed time. That person will bear the responsibility for his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a stranger resides among you and celebrates the Passover to the Lord, according to the statute of the Passover and its ordinance, so he shall celebrate it; you shall have the same statute, both for the stranger and for the native of the land.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the day that the tabernacle was erected, the cloud covered the tabernacle, the tent of the testimony, and in the evening it was like the appearance of fire over the tabernacle until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is how it was continuously; the cloud would cover it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the cloud was lifted from over the tent, afterward the sons of Israel would set out; and in the place where the cloud settled down, there the sons of Israel would camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the command of the Lord the sons of Israel would set out, and at the command of the Lord they would camp; as long as the cloud settled over the tabernacle, they remained camped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when the cloud lingered over the tabernacle for many days, the sons of Israel would comply with the Lord’s ordinance and not set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If sometimes the cloud remained a few days over the tabernacle, in accordance with the command of the Lord they remained camped. Then in accordance with the command of the Lord they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If sometimes the cloud remained from evening until morning, when the cloud was lifted in the morning they would set out; or if it remained in the daytime and at night, whenever the cloud was lifted, they would set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it was two days, a month, or a year that the cloud lingered over the tabernacle, staying above it, the sons of Israel remained camped and did not set out; but when it was lifted, they did set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the command of the Lord they camped, and at the command of the Lord they set out; they did what the Lord required, in accordance with the command of the Lord through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke further to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make yourself two trumpets of silver, you shall make them of hammered work; and you shall use them for summoning the congregation and breaking camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when both are blown, all the congregation shall meet you at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if only one is blown, then the leaders, the heads of the divisions of Israel, shall meet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you blow an alarm, the camps that are pitched on the east side shall set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when you sound an alarm the second time, the camps that are pitched on the south side shall set out; an alarm is to be sounded for them to break camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When convening the assembly, however, you shall blow the trumpets without sounding an alarm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aaron, moreover, the priests, shall blow the trumpets; and this shall be a permanent statute for you throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you go to war in your land against the enemy who attacks you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets, so that you will be thought of by the Lord your God, and be saved from your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also on the day of your joy and at your appointed feasts, and on the first days of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings, and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; and they shall be as a reminder of you before your God. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth of the month, the cloud was lifted from above the tabernacle of the testimony;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Israel set out on their journeys from the wilderness of Sinai. Then the cloud settled in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they moved on for the first time in accordance with the command of the Lord through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The flag of the camp of the sons of Judah, by their armies, set out first, with Nahshon the son of Amminadab, over its army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Nethanel the son of Zuar, over the tribal army of the sons of Issachar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Eliab the son of Helon over the tribal army of the sons of Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tabernacle was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who were carrying the tabernacle, set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next the flag of the camp of Reuben, by their armies, set out with Elizur the son of Shedeur, over its army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai over the tribal army of the sons of Simeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Eliasaph the son of Deuel was over the tribal army of the sons of Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy objects; and the tabernacle was set up before their arrival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next the flag of the camp of the sons of Ephraim, by their armies, set out, with Elishama the son of Ammihud over its army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur over the tribal army of the sons of Manasseh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Abidan the son of Gideoni over the tribal army of the sons of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the flag of the camp of the sons of Dan, by their armies, which formed the rear guard for all the camps, set out, with Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai over its army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pagiel the son of Ochran over the tribal army of the sons of Asher;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ahira the son of Enan over the tribal army of the sons of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the order of marching for the sons of Israel by their armies as they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to Hobab the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out to the place of which the Lord said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will do you good, for the Lord has promised good concerning Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “I will not come, but rather will go to my own land and relatives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Please do not leave us, since you know where we should camp in the wilderness, and you will be as eyes for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it will be, if you go with us, that whatever good the Lord does for us, we will do for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they moved on from the mountain of the Lord three days’ journey, with the ark of the covenant of the Lord going on in front of them for the three days, to seek out a resting place for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cloud of the Lord was over them by day when they set out from the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then it came about when the ark set out that Moses said,
“Rise up, Lord!
And may Your enemies be scattered,
And those who hate You flee from Your presence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when it came to rest, he said,
“Return, Lord,
To the myriad thousands of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people became like those who complain of adversity in the ears of the Lord; and the Lord heard them and His anger was kindled, and the fire of the Lord burned among them and consumed some at the outskirts of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people then cried out to Moses; and Moses prayed to the Lord, and the fire died out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that place was named Taberah, because the fire of the Lord burned among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rabble who were among them had greedy cravings; and the sons of Israel also wept again and said, “Who will give us meat to eat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We remember the fish which we used to eat for free in Egypt, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but now our appetite is gone. There is nothing at all to look at except this manna!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and its appearance like that of bdellium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people would roam about and gather it and grind it between two millstones, or pound it in the mortar, and boil it in the pot and make loaves with it; and its taste was like the taste of cake baked with oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dew came down on the camp at night, the manna would come down with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, each one at the entrance of his tent; and the anger of the Lord became very hot, and Moses was displeased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to the Lord, “Why have You been so hard on Your servant? And why have I not found favor in Your sight, that You have put the burden of all this people on me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was it I who conceived all this people? Or did I give birth to them, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your arms, as a nurse carries a nursing infant, to the land which You swore to their fathers’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where am I to get meat to give to all this people? For they weep before me, saying, ‘Give us meat so that we may eat!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not able to carry all this people by myself, because it is too burdensome for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if You are going to deal with me this way, please kill me now, if I have found favor in Your sight, and do not let me see my misery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord therefore said to Moses, “Gather for Me seventy men from the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people and their officers, and bring them to the tent of meeting, and have them take their stand there with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take away some of the Spirit who is upon you, and put Him upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, so that you will not bear it by yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to the people, ‘Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat; for you have wept in the ears of the Lord, saying, “Oh that someone would give us meat to eat! For we were well-off in Egypt.” Therefore the Lord will give you meat and you shall eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat, not one day, nor two days, nor five days, nor ten days, nor twenty days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for a whole month, until it comes out of your nose and makes you nauseated; because you have rejected the Lord who is among you and have wept before Him, saying, “Why did we ever leave Egypt?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “The people, among whom I am included, are six hundred thousand on foot! Yet You have said, ‘I will give them meat, so that they may eat for a whole month.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are flocks and herds to be slaughtered for them, so that it will be sufficient for them? Or are all the fish of the sea to be caught for them, so that it will be sufficient for them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Is the Lord’s power too little? Now you shall see whether My word will come true for you or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out and told the people the words of the Lord. He also gathered seventy men of the elders of the people, and positioned them around the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to him; and He took away some of the Spirit who was upon him and placed Him upon the seventy elders. And when the Spirit rested upon them, they prophesied. Yet they did not do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But two men had remained in the camp; the name of the one was Eldad, and the name of the other, Medad. And the Spirit rested upon them (and they were among those who had been registered, but had not gone out to the tent), and they prophesied in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So a young man ran and informed Moses, and said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua the son of Nun, the personal servant of Moses from his youth, responded and said, “My lord Moses, restrain them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? If only all the Lord’s people were prophets, that the Lord would put His Spirit upon them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses returned to the camp, both he and the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a wind burst forth from the Lord and it brought quail from the sea, and dropped them beside the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and a day’s journey on the other side all around the camp, and about two cubits deep on the surface of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people spent all that day, all night, and all the next day, and they gathered the quail (the one who gathered least gathered ten homers) and spread them out for themselves all around the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, the anger of the Lord was kindled against the people, and the Lord struck the people with a very severe plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that place was named Kibroth-hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had been greedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people set out for Hazeroth, and they remained at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married (for he had married a Cushite woman);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, “Is it a fact that the Lord has spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us as well?” And the Lord heard this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the man Moses was very humble, more than any person who was on the face of the earth.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord suddenly said to Moses and to Aaron and Miriam, “You three go out to the tent of meeting.” So the three of them went out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the tent; and He called Aaron and Miriam. When they had both come forward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said,
“Now hear My words:
If there is a prophet among you,
I, the Lord, will make Myself known to him in a vision.
I will speak with him in a dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not this way for My servant Moses;
He is faithful in all My household;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With him I speak mouth to mouth,
That is, openly, and not using mysterious language,
And he beholds the form of the Lord.
So why were you not afraid
To speak against My servant, against Moses?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the anger of the Lord burned against them and He departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the cloud had withdrawn from above the tent, behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow. As Aaron turned toward Miriam, behold, she was leprous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord, I beg you, do not hold us responsible for this sin by which we have turned out to be foolish, and by which we have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh, do not let her be like a dead person, whose flesh is half eaten away when he comes out of his mother’s womb!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “God, heal her, please!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “If her father had only spit in her face, would she not be put to shame for seven days? Have her shut outside the camp for seven days, and afterward she may be received again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Miriam was shut outside the camp for seven days, and the people did not move on until Miriam was received again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward, however, the people moved on from Hazeroth and camped in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send out men for yourself to spy out the land of Canaan, which I am going to give the sons of Israel; you shall send a man from each of their fathers’ tribes, every one a leader among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran at the command of the Lord, all of them men who were heads of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These then were their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori;
verses.speaker: Narrator
