verses.text: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Joseph, from the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land; but Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun, Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, he said to them, “Go up there into the Negev; then go up into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See what the land is like, and whether the people who live in it are strong or weak, whether they are few or many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how is the land in which they live, is it good or bad? And how are the cities in which they live, are the people in open camps or in fortifications?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how is the land, is it productive or unproductive? Are there trees in it or not? And show yourselves courageous and get some of the fruit of the land.” Now the time was the season of the first ripe grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin as far as Rehob, at Lebo-hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had gone up into the Negev, they came to Hebron where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak were. (Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to the Valley of Eshcol, and from there they cut off a branch with a single cluster of grapes; and they carried it on a pole between two men, with some of the pomegranates and the figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That place was called the Valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster which the sons of Israel cut off from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they returned from spying out the land, at the end of forty days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they went on and came to Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, in the wilderness of Paran at Kadesh; and they brought back word to them and to all the congregation, and showed them the fruit of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they reported to him and said, “We came into the land where you sent us, and it certainly does flow with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the people who live in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large. And indeed, we saw the descendants of Anak there!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amalek is living in the land of the Negev, the Hittites, the Jebusites, and the Amorites are living in the hill country, and the Canaanites are living by the sea and by the side of the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, “We should by all means go up and take possession of it, for we will certainly prevail over it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men who had gone up with him said, “We are not able to go up against the people, because they are too strong for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought a bad report of the land which they had spied out to the sons of Israel, saying, “The land through which we have gone to spy out is a land that devours its inhabitants; and all the people whom we saw in it are people of great stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We also saw the Nephilim there (the sons of Anak are part of the Nephilim); and we were like grasshoppers in our own sight, and so we were in their sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation raised their voices and cried out, and the people wept that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the sons of Israel grumbled against Moses and Aaron; and the entire congregation said to them, “If only we had died in the land of Egypt! Or even if we had died in this wilderness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So why is the Lord bringing us into this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will become plunder! Would it not be better for us to return to Egypt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to one another, “Let’s appoint a leader and return to Egypt!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces in the presence of all the assembly of the congregation of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, of those who had spied out the land, tore their clothes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they spoke to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, “The land which we passed through to spy out is an exceedingly good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord is pleased with us, then He will bring us into this land and give it to us—a land which flows with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only do not rebel against the Lord; and do not fear the people of the land, for they will be our prey. Their protection is gone from them, and the Lord is with us; do not fear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the congregation said to stone them with stones. Then the glory of the Lord appeared in the tent of meeting to all the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “How long will this people be disrespectful to Me? And how long will they not believe in Me, despite all the signs that I have performed in their midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike them with plague and dispossess them, and I will make you into a nation greater and mightier than they.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to the Lord, “Then the Egyptians will hear of it, for by Your strength You brought this people up from their midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that You, Lord, are in the midst of this people, because You, Lord, are seen eye to eye, while Your cloud stands over them; and You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day, and in a pillar of fire by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if You put this people to death all at once, then the nations who have heard of Your fame will say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Since the Lord could not bring this people into the land which He promised them by oath, He slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, please, let the power of the Lord be great, just as You have declared, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Lord is slow to anger and abundant in mercy, forgiving wrongdoing and violation of His Law; but He will by no means leave the guilty unpunished, inflicting the punishment of the fathers on the children to the third and the fourth generations.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please forgive the guilt of this people in accordance with the greatness of Your mercy, just as You also have forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said, “I have forgiven them in accordance with your word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: however, as I live, all the earth will be filled with the glory of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly all the people who have seen My glory and My signs which I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have put Me to the test these ten times and have not listened to My voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shall by no means see the land which I swore to their fathers, nor shall any of those who were disrespectful to Me see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for My servant Caleb, because he has had a different spirit and has followed Me fully, I will bring him into the land which he entered, and his descendants shall take possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites live in the valleys; turn tomorrow and set out for the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron again, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long shall I put up with this evil congregation who are grumbling against Me? I have heard the complaints of the sons of Israel which they are voicing against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘As I live,’ declares the Lord, ‘just as you have spoken in My hearing, so I will do to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your dead bodies will fall in this wilderness, all your numbered men according to your complete number from twenty years old and upward, who have grumbled against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By no means will you come into the land where I swore to settle you, except for Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your children, however, whom you said would become plunder—I will bring them in, and they will know the land which you have rejected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, your dead bodies will fall in this wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, your sons will be shepherds in the wilderness for forty years, and they will suffer for your unfaithfulness, until your bodies perish in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In accordance with the number of days that you spied out the land, forty days, for every day you shall suffer the punishment for your guilt a year, that is, forty years, and you will know My opposition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, the Lord, have spoken, I certainly will do this to all this evil congregation who are gathered together against Me. They shall be worn out in this wilderness, and there they shall die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land, and who returned and led all the congregation to grumble against him by bringing a bad report about the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those men who brought the bad report of the land also died by a plague in the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh remained alive out of those men who went to spy out the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Moses spoke these words to all the sons of Israel, the people mourned greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, however, they got up early and went up to the ridge of the hill country, saying, “Here we are; and we will go up to the place which the Lord has promised, for we have sinned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “Why then are you violating the command of the Lord, when doing so will not succeed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go up, for the Lord is not among you, to prevent you from being defeated by your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites will be there to confront you, and you will fall by the sword, since you have turned back from following the Lord. And the Lord will not be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they foolishly dared to go up to the ridge of the hill country; neither the ark of the covenant of the Lord nor Moses left the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down, and struck them and scattered them as far as Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you enter the land where you are going to live, which I am giving you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you make an offering by fire to the Lord, a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a special vow, or as a voluntary offering or at your appointed times, to make a soothing aroma to the Lord from the herd or from the flock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the one who presents his offering shall present to the Lord a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a fourth of a hin of oil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall prepare wine for the drink offering, a fourth of a hin, with the burnt offering or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or for a ram you shall prepare as a grain offering two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a third of a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the drink offering you shall offer a third of a hin of wine as a soothing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you prepare a bull as a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to fulfill a special vow, or for peace offerings to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall offer with the bull a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall offer as the drink offering half a hin of wine as an offering by fire, as a soothing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is how it shall be done for each ox, or for each ram, or for each of the male lambs, or of the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number that you prepare, so you shall do for each one according to their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who is a native shall do these things in this way, in presenting an offering by fire as a soothing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if a stranger resides among you, or one who may be among you throughout your generations, and he wants to make an offering by fire, as a soothing aroma to the Lord, just as you do so shall he do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the assembly, there shall be one statute for you and for the stranger who resides among you, a permanent statute throughout your generations; as you are, so shall the stranger be before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is to be one law and one ordinance for you and for the stranger who resides with you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you enter the land where I am bringing you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it shall be, that when you eat from the food of the land, you shall lift up an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the first of your dough you shall lift up a loaf as an offering; as an offering of the threshing floor, so you shall lift it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the first of your dough you shall give to the Lord an offering throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But when you unintentionally do wrong and fail to comply with all these commandments which the Lord has spoken to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, all that the Lord has commanded you through Moses from the day that the Lord gave commandments and onward, throughout your generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it shall be, if it is done unintentionally, without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one bull as a burnt offering, as a soothing aroma to the Lord, with its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one male goat as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the sons of Israel, and they will be forgiven; for it was an unintentional wrong, and they have brought their offering, an offering by fire to the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord, for their unintentional wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the congregation of the sons of Israel will be forgiven, as well as the stranger who resides among them, for guilt was attributed to all the people through an unintentional wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Also, if one person sins unintentionally, then he shall offer a one-year-old female goat as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall make atonement before the Lord for the person who goes astray by an unintentional sin, making atonement for him so that he may be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have one law for the native among the sons of Israel and for the stranger who resides among them, for one who does anything wrong unintentionally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who does wrong defiantly, whether he is a native or a stranger, that one is blaspheming the Lord; and that person shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since he has despised the word of the Lord and has broken His commandment, that person shall be completely cut off; his guilt will be on him.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the sons of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering wood on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses and Aaron, and to all the congregation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they placed him in custody, because it had not been decided what should be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “The man must be put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the congregation brought him outside the camp and stoned him to death with stones, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and tell them that they shall make for themselves tassels on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and that they shall put on the tassel of each corner a violet thread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be a tassel for you to look at and remember all the commandments of the Lord, so that you will do them and not follow your own heart and your own eyes, which led you to prostitute yourselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you will remember and do all My commandments and be holy to your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt to be your God; I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Korah the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they stood before Moses, together with some of the sons of Israel, 250 leaders of the congregation chosen in the assembly, men of renown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assembled together against Moses and Aaron, and said to them, “You have gone far enough! For all the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the Lord is in their midst; so why do you exalt yourselves above the assembly of the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses heard this, he fell on his face;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he spoke to Korah and all his group, saying, “Tomorrow morning the Lord will make known who is His, and who is holy, and will bring that one near to Himself; indeed, the one whom He will choose, He will bring near to Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this: take censers for yourselves, Korah and your whole group,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put fire in them, and place incense upon them in the presence of the Lord tomorrow; and the man whom the Lord chooses shall be the one who is holy. You have gone far enough, you sons of Levi!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to Korah, “Hear now, you sons of Levi:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it too small an honor for you that the God of Israel has singled you out from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to Himself, to perform the service of the tabernacle of the Lord, and to stand before the congregation to minister to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that He has brought you near, Korah, and all your brothers, sons of Levi, with you? But are you seeking the priesthood as well?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you and your whole group are the ones gathered together against the Lord; but as for Aaron, who is he, that you grumble against him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses sent a summons to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab; but they said, “We will not come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not enough that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to have us die in the wilderness, but you would also appoint yourself as master over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor have you given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Would you gouge out the eyes of these men? We will not come up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses became very angry and said to the Lord, “Pay no attention to their offering! I have not taken a single donkey from them, nor have I done harm to any of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Korah, “You and all your group be present before the Lord tomorrow, you and they along with Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each of you take his censer and put incense on it, and each of you bring his censer before the Lord, 250 censers; also you and Aaron shall each bring his censer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took, each one his own censer, and put fire on it, and placed incense on it; and they stood at the entrance of the tent of meeting, with Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Korah assembled all the congregation against them at the entrance of the tent of meeting. And the glory of the Lord appeared to all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Separate yourselves from among this congregation, so that I may consume them instantly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they fell on their faces and said, “God, the God of the spirits of humanity, when one person sins, will You be angry with the entire congregation?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the congregation, saying, ‘Get away from the areas around the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses arose and went to Dathan and Abiram, with the elders of Israel following him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he spoke to the congregation, saying, “Get away now from the tents of these wicked men, and do not touch anything that belongs to them, or you will be swept away in all their sin!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they moved away from the areas around the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram; and Dathan and Abiram came out and stood at the entrances of their tents, along with their wives, their sons, and their little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “By this you shall know that the Lord has sent me to do all these deeds; for it is not my doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If these men die the death of all mankind, or if they suffer the fate of all mankind, then the Lord has not sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the Lord brings about an entirely new thing and the ground opens its mouth and swallows them with everything that is theirs, and they descend alive into Sheol, then you will know that these men have been disrespectful to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he finished speaking all these words, the ground that was under them split open;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, their households, and all the people who belonged to Korah with all their possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they and all that belonged to them went down alive to Sheol; and the earth closed over them, and they perished from the midst of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all Israel who were around them fled at their outcry, for they said, “The earth might swallow us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fire also came out from the Lord and consumed the 250 men who were offering the incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, that he shall pick up the censers from the midst of the burned area, because they are holy; and you are to scatter the burning coals farther away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the censers of these men who have sinned at the cost of their own lives, have them made into hammered sheets as plating for the altar, since they did present them before the Lord and they are holy; and they shall serve as a sign to the sons of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priest Eleazar took the bronze censers which the men who were burned had offered, and they hammered them out as plating for the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as a reminder to the sons of Israel so that no layman, anyone who was not of the descendants of Aaron, would approach to burn incense before the Lord; then he would not become like Korah and his group—just as the Lord had spoken to him through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the next day all the congregation of the sons of Israel grumbled against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You are the ones who have caused the death of the Lord’s people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about, however, when the congregation had assembled against Moses and Aaron, that they turned toward the tent of meeting, and behold, the cloud covered it and the glory of the Lord appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron came to the front of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get away from among this congregation so that I may consume them instantly.” Then they fell on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Aaron, “Take your censer and put fire in it from the altar, and place incense on it; then bring it quickly to the congregation and make atonement for them, for wrath has gone out from the Lord, the plague has begun!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron took it just as Moses had spoken, and he ran into the midst of the assembly; and behold, the plague had begun among the people. So he put on the incense and made atonement for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took his stand between the dead and the living, so that the plague was brought to a halt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who died by the plague were 14,700 in number, besides those who died on account of Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance of the tent of meeting, for the plague had been brought to a halt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and obtain from them a staff for each father’s household: twelve staffs, from all their leaders for their fathers’ households. You shall write each man’s name on his staff,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and write Aaron’s name on the staff of Levi; for there is to be one staff for the head of each of their fathers’ households.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall then leave them in the tent of meeting in front of the testimony, where I meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will come about that the staff of the man whom I choose will sprout. So I will relieve Myself of the grumblings of the sons of Israel, who are grumbling against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke to the sons of Israel, and all their leaders gave him a staff, one for each leader, for their fathers’ households, twelve staffs in all, with the staff of Aaron among their staffs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses left the staffs before the Lord in the tent of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the next day Moses went into the tent of the testimony; and behold, Aaron’s staff for the house of Levi had sprouted and produced buds and bloomed with blossoms, and it yielded ripe almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses then brought out all the staffs from the presence of the Lord to all the sons of Israel; and they looked, and each man took his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Put the staff of Aaron back in front of the testimony to be kept as a sign against the rebels, so that you may put an end to their grumblings against Me and they do not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did so; just as the Lord had commanded him, so he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, “Behold, we are passing away, we are perishing, we are all perishing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who comes near, who comes near to the tabernacle of the Lord, must die. Are we to perish completely?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Aaron, “You, your sons, and your father’s household with you shall bear the guilt in connection with the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you shall bear the guilt in connection with your priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But also bring your brothers with you, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, so that they may join you and serve you, while you and your sons with you are before the tent of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall perform duties for you and the duties of the whole tent, but they shall not come near the furnishings of the sanctuary and the altar, or both they and you will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall join you and perform the duties of the tent of meeting, for all the service of the tent; but an unauthorized person shall not come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall perform the duties of the sanctuary and the duties of the altar, so that there will no longer be wrath on the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I Myself have taken your fellow Levites from among the sons of Israel; they are a gift to you, dedicated to the Lord, to perform the service for the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you and your sons with you shall attend to your priesthood for everything that concerns the altar and inside the veil, and you are to perform service. I am giving you the priesthood as a service that is a gift, and the unauthorized person who comes near shall be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Aaron, “Now behold, I Myself have put you in charge of My offerings, all the holy gifts of the sons of Israel I have given to you as a portion and to your sons as a permanent allotment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be yours from the most holy gifts reserved from the fire; every offering of theirs, namely every grain offering, every sin offering, and every guilt offering, with which they shall make restitution to Me, shall be most holy for you and for your sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the most holy gifts you shall eat it; every male shall eat it. It shall be holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also is yours, the offering of their gift, that is, all the wave offerings of the sons of Israel; I have given them to you and to your sons and daughters with you as a permanent allotment. Everyone of your household who is clean may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the best of the fresh oil and all the best of the fresh wine and of the grain, the first fruits of what they give to the Lord, I have given them to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first ripe fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring to the Lord, shall be yours; everyone of your household who is clean may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything banned from secular use in Israel shall be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every firstborn of the womb of all flesh, whether human or animal, which they offer to the Lord, shall be yours; however you must redeem the human firstborn, and the firstborn of unclean animals you shall redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to their redemption price, from a month old you shall redeem them, by your assessment, five shekels in silver by the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the firstborn of an ox, the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat, you shall not redeem; they are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar and offer up their fat in smoke as an offering by fire, for a soothing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, their meat shall be yours; it shall be yours like the breast of a wave offering and like the right thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the offerings of the holy gifts, which the sons of Israel offer to the Lord, I have given to you and your sons and your daughters with you, as a permanent allotment. It is a permanent covenant of salt before the Lord to you and your descendants with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Aaron, “You shall have no inheritance in their land nor own any portion among them; I am your portion and your inheritance among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To the sons of Levi, behold, I have given all the tithe in Israel as an inheritance, in return for their service which they perform, the service of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel shall not come near the tent of meeting again, or they will bring sin on themselves and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the Levites shall perform the service of the tent of meeting, and they shall bear their own guilt; it shall be a permanent statute throughout your generations, and among the sons of Israel they shall have no inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tithe of the sons of Israel, which they offer as an offering to the Lord, I have given to the Levites as an inheritance; therefore I have said concerning them, ‘They shall have no inheritance among the sons of Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, you shall speak to the Levites and say to them, ‘When you take from the sons of Israel the tithe which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then you shall present an offering from it to the Lord, a tithe of the tithe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your offering shall be credited to you like the grain from the threshing floor or the full produce from the wine vat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall also present an offering to the Lord from all your tithes, which you receive from the sons of Israel; and from it you shall give the Lord’s offering to Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of all your gifts you shall present every offering due to the Lord, from all the best of them, the sacred part from them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to them, ‘When you have offered from it the best of it, then the rest shall be credited to the Levites like the product of the threshing floor, and like the product of the wine vat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat it anywhere, you and your households, for it is your compensation in return for your service in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will bring on yourselves no sin by reason of it when you have offered the best of it. But you shall not profane the sacred gifts of the sons of Israel, so that you do not die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the statute of the law which the Lord has commanded, saying, ‘Speak to the sons of Israel that they bring you an unblemished red heifer in which there is no defect and on which a yoke has never been mounted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall give it to Eleazar the priest, and it shall be brought outside the camp and be slaughtered in his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle some of its blood toward the front of the tent of meeting seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the heifer shall be burned in his sight; its hide, its flesh, and its blood, with its refuse, shall be burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and scarlet material, and throw it into the midst of the burning heifer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall then wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterward come into the camp; but the priest will be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who burns the heifer shall also wash his clothes in water and bathe his body in water, and will be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and put them outside the camp in a clean place, and the congregation of the sons of Israel shall keep them for water to remove impurity; it is purification from sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening; and it shall be a permanent statute for the sons of Israel and for the stranger who resides among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The one who touches the dead body of any person will also be unclean for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That one shall purify himself with the water on the third day and on the seventh day, and then he will be clean; but if he does not purify himself on the third day and on the seventh day, he will not be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who touches a dead body, the body of a person who has died, and does not purify himself, defiles the tabernacle of the Lord; and that person shall be cut off from Israel. Since the water for impurity was not sprinkled on him, he will be unclean; his uncleanness is still on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is the law when a person dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent and everyone who is in the tent will be unclean for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every open container, which has no cover tied down on it, will be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, anyone who in the open field touches one who has been killed with a sword or one who has died naturally, or touches a human bone or a grave, will be unclean for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then for the unclean person they shall take some of the ashes of the burnt purification from sin and running water shall be added to them in a container.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a clean person shall take hyssop and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it on the tent, on all the furnishings, on the persons who were there, and on the one who touched the bone or the one who was killed or the one who died naturally, or the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day; and on the seventh day he shall purify him, and he shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water and will be clean by evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But the person who is unclean and does not purify himself, that person shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly, because he has defiled the sanctuary of the Lord; the water for impurity has not been sprinkled on him, so he is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it shall be a permanent statute for them. And the one who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and the one who touches the water for impurity will be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, anything that the unclean person touches will be unclean; and the person who touches it will be unclean until evening.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel, the whole congregation, came to the wilderness of Zin in the first month; and the people stayed at Kadesh. Now Miriam died there and was buried there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no water for the congregation, and they assembled against Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people argued with Moses and spoke, saying, “If only we had perished when our brothers perished before the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then have you brought the Lord’s assembly into this wilderness, for us and our livestock to die here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you make us come up from Egypt, to bring us into this wretched place? It is not a place of grain or figs or vines or pomegranates, nor is there water to drink!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron came in from the presence of the assembly to the entrance of the tent of meeting and fell on their faces. And the glory of the Lord appeared to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the staff; and you and your brother Aaron assemble the congregation and speak to the rock before their eyes, that it shall yield its water. So you shall bring water for them out of the rock, and have the congregation and their livestock drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the staff from before the Lord, just as He had commanded him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses and Aaron summoned the assembly in front of the rock. And he said to them, “Listen now, you rebels; shall we bring water for you out of this rock?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his staff; and water came out abundantly, and the congregation and their livestock drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “Since you did not trust in Me, to treat Me as holy in the sight of the sons of Israel, for that reason you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those were called the waters of Meribah, because the sons of Israel argued with the Lord, and He proved Himself holy among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kadesh Moses then sent messengers to the king of Edom to say, “This is what your brother Israel has said: ‘You know all the hardship that has overtaken us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that our fathers went down to Egypt, and we stayed in Egypt a long time, and the Egyptians treated us and our fathers badly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when we cried out to the Lord, He heard our voice and sent an angel, and brought us out from Egypt; now behold, we are at Kadesh, a town on the edge of your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through field or vineyard; we will not even drink water from a well. We will go along the king’s road, not turning to the right or left, until we pass through your territory.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, however, said to him, “You shall not pass through us, or I will come out with the sword against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the sons of Israel said to him, “We will go up by the road, and if I and my livestock do drink any of your water, then I will pay its price. Let me only pass through on my feet, nothing more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “You shall not pass through.” And Edom came out against him with a heavy force and a strong hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Edom refused to allow Israel to pass through his territory; then Israel turned away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they set out from Kadesh, the sons of Israel, the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron at Mount Hor by the border of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aaron will be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter the land which I have given to the sons of Israel, because you rebelled against My command at the waters of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar, and bring them up to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then strip Aaron of his garments and put them on his son Eleazar. So Aaron will be gathered to his people and will die there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did just as the Lord had commanded, and they went up to Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Moses stripped Aaron of his garments and put them on his son Eleazar, Aaron died there on the mountain top. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the congregation saw that Aaron had died, the whole house of Israel wept for Aaron for thirty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, he fought against Israel and took some of them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel made a vow to the Lord and said, “If You will indeed hand over this people to me, then I will utterly destroy their cities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord heard the voice of Israel and turned over the Canaanites; then they utterly destroyed them and their cities. And the place was named Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they set out from Mount Hor by the way of the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom; and the people became impatient because of the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people spoke against God and Moses: “Why have you brought us up from Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no food and no water, and we are disgusted with this miserable food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord sent fiery serpents among the people and they bit the people, so that many people of Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned, because we have spoken against the Lord and against you; intercede with the Lord, that He will remove the serpents from us.” And Moses interceded for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Make a fiery serpent, and put it on a flag pole; and it shall come about, that everyone who is bitten, and looks at it, will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses made a bronze serpent and put it on the flag pole; and it came about, that if a serpent bit someone, and he looked at the bronze serpent, he lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sons of Israel moved out and camped in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they journeyed from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness which is opposite Moab, to the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they set out and camped in Wadi Zered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they journeyed and camped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that comes out of the border of the Amorites; for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For that reason it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord,
“Waheb in Suphah,
And the wadis of the Arnon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the slope of the wadis
That extends to the site of Ar,
And leans to the border of Moab.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they continued to Beer, that is the well where the Lord said to Moses, “Assemble the people, that I may give them water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Israel sang this song:
“Spring up, O well! Sing to it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The well, which the leaders dug,
Which the nobles of the people hollowed out,
With the scepter and with their staffs.”
And from the wilderness they continued to Mattanah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the land of Moab, at the top of Pisgah, which overlooks the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon, king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let me pass through your land. We will not turn off into field or vineyard; we will not drink water from wells. We will go by the king’s road until we have passed through your border.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sihon would not permit Israel to pass through his border. Instead, Sihon gathered all his people and went out against Israel in the wilderness, and came to Jahaz and fought against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel struck him with the edge of the sword, and took possession of his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as the sons of Ammon; for the border of the sons of Ammon was Jazer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel took all these cities, and Israel lived in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon and in all her villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and had taken all his land out of his hand, as far as the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For that reason those who use proverbs say,
“Come to Heshbon! Let it be built!
So let the city of Sihon be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a fire spread from Heshbon,
A flame from the town of Sihon;
It devoured Ar of Moab,
The dominant heights of the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you, Moab!
You are destroyed, people of Chemosh!
He has given his sons as fugitives,
And his daughters into captivity,
To an Amorite king, Sihon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But we have shot them down with arrows,
Heshbon is destroyed as far as Dibon,
Then we have laid waste as far as Nophah,
Which reaches to Medeba.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses sent men to spy out Jazer, and they captured its villages and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned and went up by the way of Bashan, and Og the king of Bashan went out against them with all his people, for battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I have handed him over to you, and all his people and his land; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they killed him and his sons and all his people, until there was no survivor left; and they took possession of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel journeyed on, and camped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan opposite Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moab was in great fear because of the people, for they were numerous; and Moab was in dread of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this horde will eat up all that is around us, as the ox eats up the grass of the field!” And Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, at Pethor, which is near the Euphrates River, in the land of the sons of his people, to call for him, saying, “Behold, a people came out of Egypt; behold, they have covered the surface of the land, and they are living opposite me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, please come, curse this people for me since they are too mighty for me; perhaps I will be able to defeat them and drive them out of the land. For I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian left with the fees for divination in their hands; and they came to Balaam and repeated Balak’s words to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Spend the night here, and I will bring word back to you just as the Lord may speak to me.” And the leaders of Moab stayed with Balaam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent word to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, there is a people who came out of Egypt, and they cover the surface of the land; now come, curse them for me; perhaps I will be able to fight against them and drive them out.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them; you shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam got up in the morning and said to Balak’s representatives, “Go back to your land, for the Lord has refused to let me go with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the representatives from Moab got up and went to Balak, and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak sent representatives once again, more numerous and more distinguished than the previous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Balaam and said to him, “This is what Balak the son of Zippor says: ‘I beg you, let nothing keep you from coming to me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will indeed honor you richly, and I will do whatever you tell me. Please come then, curse this people for me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Balaam replied to the servants of Balak, “Even if Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything, either small or great, contrary to the command of the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now please, you also stay here tonight, and I will find out what else the Lord will say to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came to Balaam at night and said to him, “If the men have come to call you, rise and go with them; but you shall do only the thing that I tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam arose in the morning, saddled his donkey, and went with the leaders of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God was angry that he was going, and the angel of the Lord took his stand in the road as an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with his sword drawn in his hand, the donkey turned off from the road and went into the field; and Balaam struck the donkey to guide her back onto the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path of the vineyards, with a stone wall on this side and on that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she pressed herself against the wall and pressed Balaam’s foot against the wall, so he struck her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord went farther, and stood in a narrow place where there was no way to turn to the right or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she lay down under Balaam; so Balaam was angry and struck the donkey with his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to the donkey, “It is because you have made a mockery of me! If only there had been a sword in my hand! For I would have killed you by now!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey on which you have ridden all your life to this day? Have I ever been in the habit of doing such a thing to you?” And he said, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord opened Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way with his sword drawn in his hand; and he bowed all the way to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out as an adversary, because your way was reckless and contrary to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the donkey saw me and turned away from me these three times. If she had not turned away from me, I certainly would have killed you just now, and let her live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, “I have sinned, for I did not know that you were standing in the way against me. Now then, if it is displeasing to you, I will turn back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel of the Lord said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but you shall speak only the word that I tell you.” So Balaam went along with the representatives of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the city of Moab, which is on the Arnon border, at the extreme end of the border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not urgently send word to you to call for you? Why did you not come to me? Am I really unable to honor you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam said to Balak, “Behold, I have come to you now! Am I really able to speak anything? The word that God puts in my mouth, that only shall I speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and sent some to Balaam and the leaders who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it came about in the morning that Balak took Balaam and brought him up to the high places of Baal, and he saw from there a portion of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak did just as Balaam had spoken, and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stand beside your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps the Lord will come to meet me, and whatever He shows me I will tell you.” So he went to a bare hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now God met with Balaam, and he said to Him, “I have set up the seven altars, and I have offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak, and this is what you shall speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he returned to him, and behold, he was standing beside his burnt offering, he and all the leaders of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he took up his discourse and said,
“From Aram Balak has brought me,
Moab’s king from the mountains of the East, saying,
‘Come, declare Jacob cursed for me,
And come, curse Israel!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How am I to put a curse on him upon whom God has not put a curse?
And how am I to curse him whom the Lord has not cursed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I see him from the top of the rocks,
And I look at him from the hills;
Behold, a people that lives in isolation,
And does not consider itself to be among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has counted the dust of Jacob,
Or the number of the fourth part of Israel?
May I die the death of the upright,
And may my end be like his!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to put a curse on my enemies, but behold, you have actually blessed them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “Must I not be careful to speak what the Lord puts in my mouth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place from where you may see them, although you will only see the extreme end of them and will not see all of them; and put a curse on them for me from there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he took him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and he built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Balak, “Stand here beside your burnt offering while I myself meet the Lord over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord met Balaam and put a word in his mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and this is what you shall speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he came to him, and behold, he was standing beside his burnt offering, and the leaders of Moab with him. And Balak said to him, “What has the Lord spoken?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God is not a man, that He would lie,
Nor a son of man, that He would change His mind;
Has He said, and will He not do it?
Or has He spoken, and will He not make it good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I have received a command to bless;
When He has blessed, I cannot revoke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God brings them out of Egypt,
He is for them like the horns of the wild ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there is no magic curse against Jacob,
Nor is there any divination against Israel;
At the proper time it shall be said to Jacob
And to Israel, what God has done!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, a people rises like a lioness,
And like a lion it raises itself;
It will not lie down until it devours the prey,
And drinks the blood of those slain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Do not curse them at all nor bless them at all!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Balaam replied to Balak, “Did I not tell you, ‘Whatever the Lord speaks, I must do’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Please come, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will be agreeable with God that you curse them for me from there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak did just as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he did not go as at other times to seek omens, rather he turned his attention toward the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam raised his eyes and saw Israel camping tribe by tribe; and the Spirit of God came upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The declaration of him who hears the words of God,
Who sees the vision of the Almighty,
Falling down, yet having his eyes uncovered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How pleasant are your tents, Jacob,
Your dwelling places, Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like valleys that stretch out,
Like gardens beside a river,
Like aloes planted by the Lord,
Like cedars beside the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Water will flow from his buckets,
And his seed will be by many waters,
And his king shall be higher than Agag,
And his kingdom shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God brings him out of Egypt,
He is for him like the horns of the wild ox.
He will devour the nations who are his adversaries,
And will crush their bones,
And smash them with his arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He crouches, he lies down like a lion,
And like a lioness, who dares to rouse him?
Blessed is everyone who blesses you,
And cursed is everyone who curses you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak’s anger burned against Balaam, and he struck his hands together; and Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, but behold, you have persisted in blessing them these three times!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So flee to your place now. I said I would honor you greatly, but behold, the Lord has held you back from honor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not in fact tell your messengers whom you had sent to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything contrary to the command of the Lord, either good or bad, of my own accord. What the Lord speaks, I will speak’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, behold, I am going to my people; come, and I will advise you of what this people will do to your people in the days to come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he took up his discourse and said,
“The declaration of Balaam the son of Beor,
And the declaration of the man whose eye is opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The declaration of him who hears the words of God,
And knows the knowledge of the Most High,
Who sees the vision of the Almighty,
Falling down, yet having his eyes uncovered:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And Edom shall be a possession,
Seir, its enemies, also will be a possession,
While Israel performs valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One from Jacob shall rule,
And will eliminate the survivors from the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he looked at Amalek and took up his discourse and said,
“Amalek was the first of the nations,
But his end shall be destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he looked at the Kenite, and took up his discourse and said,
“Your dwelling place is enduring,
And your nest is set in the cliff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless Kain will suffer devastation;
How long will Asshur keep you captive?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he took up his discourse and said,
“Oh, who can live unless God has ordained it?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam arose, and he departed and returned to his place, and Balak also went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Israel remained at Shittim, the people began to commit infidelity with the daughters of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel became followers of Baal of Peor, and the Lord was angry with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Take all the leaders of the people and execute them in broad daylight before the Lord, so that the fierce anger of the Lord may turn away from Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Each of you kill his men who have become followers of Baal of Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, one of the sons of Israel came and brought to his relatives a Midianite woman, in the sight of Moses and in the sight of the whole congregation of the sons of Israel, while they were weeping at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from the midst of the congregation and took a spear in his hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he went after the man of Israel into the inner room of the tent and pierced both of them, the man of Israel and the woman, through the abdomen. So the plague on the sons of Israel was brought to a halt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who died from the plague were twenty-four thousand in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has averted My wrath from the sons of Israel in that he was jealous with My jealousy among them, so that I did not destroy the sons of Israel in My jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘Behold, I am giving him My covenant of peace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall be for him and for his descendants after him, a covenant of a permanent priesthood, because he was jealous for his God and made atonement for the sons of Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the name of the dead man of Israel who was killed with the Midianite woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, a leader of a father’s household among the Simeonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi the daughter of Zur, who was head of the people of a father’s household in Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be hostile to the Midianites and attack them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they have been hostile to you with their tricks, with which they have deceived you in the matter of Peor and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of the leader of Midian, their sister who was killed on the day of the plague because of Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it came about after the plague, that the Lord spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the sons of Israel from twenty years old and upward, by their fathers’ households, whoever is able to go to war in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Take a census of the people from twenty years old and upward, as the Lord has commanded Moses.”
Now the sons of Israel who came out of the land of Egypt were as follows:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, the sons of Reuben: of Hanoch, the family of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the family of the Palluites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Reubenites, and those who were counted of them were 43,730.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Pallu: Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliab: Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram who were called by the congregation, who fought against Moses and against Aaron in the group of Korah, when they fought against the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up along with Korah, when that group died, when the fire devoured 250 men, so that they became a warning sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Korah, however, did not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon by their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Simeonites, 22,200 in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad by their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the family of the Haggites; of Shuni, the family of the Shunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Ozni, the family of the Oznites; of Eri, the family of the Erites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Gad according to those who were numbered of them, 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan, but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah by their families were: of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites; of Perez, the family of the Perezites; of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Judah by those who were numbered of them, 76,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar by their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the family of the Punites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Issachar by those who were numbered of them, 64,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun by their families: of Sered, the family of the Seredites; of Elon, the family of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Zebulunites by those who were numbered of them, 60,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Joseph by their families: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites; and Machir fathered Gilead: of Gilead, the family of the Gileadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Iezer, the family of the Iezerites; of Helek, the family of the Helekites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites; and of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites; and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, only daughters; and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Manasseh; and those who were numbered of them were 52,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ephraim by their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the family of the Becherites; of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim by those who were numbered of them, 32,500. These are the sons of Joseph by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin by their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Shephupham, the family of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites; of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Benjamin by their families; and those who were numbered of them were 45,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dan by their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the families of the Shuhamites, by those who were numbered of them, were 64,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher by their families: of Imnah, the family of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the family of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Asher by those who were numbered of them, 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali by their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the family of the Gunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Naphtali by their families; and those who were numbered of them were 45,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones who were numbered of the sons of Israel, 601,730.
verses.speaker: Narrator
